body:
The XMLNS namespace is a special case, e.g. for [setAttributeNS(namespace, name, value)](http://www.w3.org/TR/dom/#dom-element-setattributens):

> 1. If namespace is the XMLNS namespace and neither name nor prefix is "xmlns", throw a "NamespaceError" exception.

The problem here is that we always call `setAttributeNS(namespace, localName, value)`, dropping the prefix.  In the example above we call `setAttributeNS("http://www.w3.org/2000/xmlns/", "ex", "http://example.com/")`, triggering the exception.

One option could be to drop the xmlns prefix from d3.ns.qualify.  However, we currently drop unsupported prefixes entirely, so the call to setAttribute wouldn’t have the desired effect.

(By the way, for your specific example, you can set the xmlns attributes using the DOM API directly by using selection.node() to retrieve the first Element in the selection.  It would be nice to find a solution in D3 if possible though.)
Yes, at the moment I add the namespace with the DOM API. A solution to get this to work with D3 would be great. It would be way cleaner than adding workarounds :)

So, instead of:

``` js
element.setAttributeNS("http://www.w3.org/2000/xmlns/", "ex", "http://example.com/");
```

We should be saying:

``` js
element.setAttributeNS("http://www.w3.org/2000/xmlns/", "xmlns:ex", "http://example.com/");
```

Is that it?
Is that implemented ? (would be nice when out)

Seems like XML is a special namespace, too?

> NAMESPACE_ERR: Raised if the qualifiedName is malformed, if the qualifiedName has a prefix and the namespaceURI is null, if the qualifiedName has a prefix that is "xml" and the namespaceURI is different from "http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace", or if the qualifiedName is "xmlns" and the namespaceURI is different from "http://www.w3.org/2000/xmlns/".

But I can’t think of any examples where we use an "xml:…" attribute.
Hmm. Seems like only XMLNS should be treated specially, according to empirical testing. So maybe we’ll start there.

issue.title: 'xmlns:xmlns:xlink': Uncaught NamespaceError

repository.name: d3plus
repository.description: A javascript library that extends D3.js to enable fast and beautiful visualizations.

issue.body:
When using d3 >= 3.5.7 with the latest d3plus (1.8.0), I get the following error in my dev-env:

`Uncaught NamespaceError: Failed to execute 'setAttributeNS' on 'Element': The qualified name provided ('xmlns:xmlns:xlink') contains multiple colons.`

And any d3plus visualization does not initialize since the xlink namespace attribute doesn't get added to the svg, so I have to use d3 v3.5.6 for it to work.

This is probably due to this solved issue in d3:
https://github.com/mbostock/d3/issues/1935

issue.title: Update dependencies + bye bye 'old d3 quirk'

repository.name: plotly.js
repository.description: Open-source JavaScript charting library behind Plotly and Dash

issue.body:
@alexcjohnson @mdtusz @cldougl 

I updated all out dependencies to their latest versions (using `npm outdated`).

Everything went smoothly, **except for** `d3` where in its v3.5.7 fixed the _old d3 quirk_ requiring the `xmlns` namespaces to be input twice in `.attr()`.

Issue: https://github.com/mbostock/d3/issues/1935
Fix: https://github.com/mbostock/d3/commit/a6f66e9dd37f764403fc7c1f26be09ab4af24fed

I took the opportunity to add a file under `src/constants` exporting all the xmlns urls.

issue.title: Include “xlink:” prefix when setting xlink attributes?

repository.name: d3-selection
repository.description: Transform the DOM by selecting elements and joining to data.

issue.body:
### situation:

When using `selection.attr()` to set a `xlink:href`-attribute then the [namspace function](https://github.com/d3/d3-selection/blob/master/src/namespace.js)  detaches the `xlink:`-prefix.

When there is a SVG gradient like ...

``` SVG
<linearGradient id="gradient"/>
```

... and you apply ...

``` JavaScript
d3.select("#gradient")
    .attr("xlink:href", "#anotherGradient");
```

... then you get ...

``` SVG
<linearGradient id="gradient" href="#anotherGradient"/>
```

My Firefox 48.0.2 browser correctly renders this gradient on use ([try yourself](https://jsfiddle.net/96zL6ghn/)). 
### problem:

However the `xlink:`-prefix is part of the attribute name according to the [SVG standard](https://www.w3.org/TR/SVG/pservers.html#LinearGradientElementHrefAttribute). 

``` SVG
<linearGradient id="gradient" xlink:href="#anotherGradient"/>
```

... is more conform to the standard.

So the `xlink:`-prefix is missing when using `d3.attr()` to set the `xlink:href`-attribute for linear gradients of SVG.
### goal:

It is our goal to conform the SVG standard when creating SVG structures.
### proposal:

So I propose to include the `xlink:`-prefix into [the set of non-detachable prefixes that currently contains the `xmlns:`-prefix](https://github.com/d3/d3-selection/blob/master/src/namespace.js). Yet I don't know if it is useful to detach the `xlink:`-prefix in other places.

issue.title: Implement SVG support

repository.name: replica
repository.description: A remote virtual DOM library for Haskell

issue.body:
From: https://github.com/pkamenarsky/replica/issues/11

- [x] Modify the VNode and VLeaf VDOM constructors to include a flag that indicates whether to use the *NS functions
- [x] Respect that flag in JS land
- [ ] Call the *AttributeNS functions whenever an attribute is created/updated on an NS node
